Multi-omics RNA/Proteomics workflow for VisomX

multiomics.workflow.Rd

multiomics.workflow() coordinates the existing RNA sequencing (rna.workflow) and proteomics (prot.workflow) pipelines, optionally aligning samples, sharing sample-level covariates, and augmenting the proteomics results with the covariate correlation analyses that were previously only available for RNA data.

Usage

multiomics.workflow(
  rna_se,
  prot_se,
  sample_covariates = NULL,
  match_samples = c("intersection", "none"),
  rna_args = list(),
  prot_args = list(),
  prot_covariate = TRUE,
  prot_covariate_options = list(),
  quiet = FALSE
)

Arguments

rna_se

A SummarizedExperiment containing RNA-seq counts prepared for rna.workflow().

prot_se

A SummarizedExperiment containing proteomics intensities prepared for prot.workflow().

sample_covariates

Optional data.frame of sample-level covariates (rownames must correspond to sample identifiers). Numeric columns are used for covariate correlation analyses.

match_samples

Either "intersection" (default) to restrict both assays and covariates to the overlapping sample names, or "none" to run the workflows on the supplied objects without enforcing overlap.

rna_args

Named list of additional arguments forwarded to rna.workflow(). Entries override defaults set by multiomics.workflow().

prot_args

Named list of additional arguments forwarded to prot.workflow().

prot_covariate

Logical (default TRUE); if TRUE and covariates are provided they are forwarded to prot.workflow() so that protein/pathway correlation analyses are executed.

prot_covariate_options

Named list whose entries override the corresponding arguments in prot.workflow() (e.g. correlate_proteins, correlate_pathways, pathway_min_genes, correlation_method, correlation_p_adjust, correlation_var_filter, correlation_min_sd, correlation_low_n, gsea_covariates).

quiet

Logical; passed through to rna.workflow() when not already supplied via rna_args.

Value

A list containing the RNA and proteomics workflow outputs enriched with shared metadata. The top-level entries include rna, proteomics, samples, sample_covariates, shared_contrasts, and metadata.

Details

The helper makes it easy to run both assays side-by-side and collect shared metadata such as overlapping samples, contrasts, and proteomics covariate associations. Proteomics covariate correlations are appended to the returned objects when requested.

See also

rna.workflow, prot.workflow
